textBox.richText: Indonesia occupied East Timor from 1975 until 1999, with final realization of independence in 2002. Torture, starvation, massacre and summary executions were suffered for twenty five years. Out of a population of less than one million, the East Timorese are estimated to have lost more than 100,000. A short reading list can be found on the Bibliography of the East Timor Genocide page.
